children.subject: Good question. I need some Hug lectures in my life!

history.content:
Given that he's also teaching Data 100 in the fall, I would guess it would be unlikely that he'll also create new lecture videos for 186. No clue though.

And yeah, all of the videos are at https://www.youtube.com/user/CS186Berkeley/videos

------

They're almost certainly going to stay the same for the foreseeable future; I don't think Josh Hug plans on actually lecturing for it. Answer above is correct for the videos, though anyone can audit the edge.edx course for a more structured layout

Given that he's also teaching Data 100 in the fall, I would guess it would be unlikely that he'll also create new lecture videos for 186. No clue though.

And yeah, all of the videos are at https://www.youtube.com/user/CS186Berkeley/videos

children.subject: There are still course logistics that the professor needs to oversee such as exam-writing, assignment creation, course policies, etc. I agree with the student answer that it's unlikely he will be creating new videos for CS 186, especially since it is listed under CS W186 which would suggest it's the same web course as right now.

Joe put a lot of work into making 186 a course whose lectures were fully online so that he didn't have to call in friends from industry to teach it every other semester.

The professors now oversee the things the followup above discussed. It's almost certain Josh Hug won't be creating new webcast videos unless things drastically change.

As a follow up to student answer, given that Hug is listed as the professor, I thought he would be making lecture videos, otherwise not sure why he would be listed. Could any instructor please confirm if possible?

history.content: Since the lectures are all videos of an EdX course, do the lecture videos change depending on the semester/professor, or are they the same every semester. Also, can students not currently enrolled in the class access the videos?
history.subject: cs w186 lecture videos
